title: Glassy carbon electrode modified with a film of tetraruthenated nickel(II) porphyrin located in natural smectite clay's interlayer for the simultaneous sensing of dopamine, acetaminophen and tryptophan
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,19592-19602
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA03253E, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Justin Claude Kemmegne-Mbouguen, Guy Bertrand Tamne, Marcelline Carine Ngo-Ngwem, Henrique Eisi Toma, Koiti Araki, Vera Regina Leopoldo Constantino, Lúcio Angnes
An organoclay was obtained by intercalating a cationic Ni(II) porphyrin into a natural smectite sheets using batch method. Stable organoclay film modified GCEs were then prepared for the determination of dopamine, acetaminophen and tryptophan.
